the kmarc can handle that ship we area small mining company hanland tried to force to be clients to say the leas it was like the kermaricain revolution a small band of miners lead by m self (made a kerbal with my name) and fought of a old shade prototype (not very good) we used mining probes as weapons and for years have bean un able to call out for help till hanland started the war we used this to help spirtwolf we sneak supplies to there abandoned crews and use are ships to protect them we will not let hanland LIV THROUGHT THIS WAR AND WE SURE AS HELL WOUNT DIE NOW SO GIVE US THE DAMN SHIP PLEASE EMIAL IS [email protected]

New 51 ton light cruiser Drekevak Fifteen-II. 2 ASMs, 2AFMs, with room for more and the abillity to carry 2 drop tanks. Ideal for the small navy; this ship can operate by itself against fighters or cruisers.

But will it blend? Great ship though, dayum!

Edited October 20, 2013 by Cruzan
the order of the hunter just got a new member

right, i had a ship design back before the battle of laythe, but all the updates have rendered it obsolete. it was going to be a robotic comms ship that would orbit between laythe and kerban, relaying comm traffic and doing signal interception and decryption, but i never was able to get it space before update .21 went live. anyway, i was going to try and revive this old ship concept, if you guys think it would be good. i have a few military ships in mind, for both Spiritwolf and Hanland, but they are less built and more idealistic blueprints at this point. anyway, just wanted some critique about the idea of a robotic comm vessel, for SpiritWolf, of course. Hanland dont need more intel resources. they apparently have to many as it is.

well, i have the new hull laid down, once i have the booster set for getting it into orbit, i can then add the comm equipment to the ship. Right now, the part count for final stage should be below 300, even with all the comm and solar panel arrays i am going to add.

Edited October 23, 2013 by K3rbalcorp

good to see this place is still up. Edited October 25, 2013 by camulus777
wrong thread

Hi guys, got a couple of new submissions to post; a low part version of the Nemesis class and a civilian research base.

First up, the Nemesis class destroyer:

Stats: 349 parts (499 at launch), 84t, 1575 LF and 200 MP. Crew of 1,

Ammo: 3 1m smart torps and 16 girder rockets.

Proof: http://imgur.com/a/W854Q

Ship file: http://www./?wqsbo88vq6jg3g5

This ship is designed to be a short ranged and heavily armoured fleet support vessel, easily capable of dealing with any target, it has double layered armour with an extra central sleeve to protect the vital workings of the ship. In order to reduce the part count from the original 500 odd all redundant systems, docking ports and struts have been removed from the original design.

I have yet to move this ship to Laythe, I will probably wait until we hear news from the great man himself, I'm a little bored of doing the trip these days.

Edited October 26, 2013 by Mr Tegu

Next up, the Laythe Lander:

Stats: 187parts (359 launch), 5700LF, 1600MP, crew of 2 (4 max)

Finally, Dark Star has spread it's influence to surface operations on Laythe. This ship is capable of doing the return trip and touring the moons of Jool without refueling at any time. The lander module is equipped with the new science parts and will unlock a huge portion of the tech tree if used for career mode. The lander is also equally at home on land and water and features booster jets making it ideal for the Laythe environment.

File: http://www./download/1zism34agx4bbfb/Laythe_Lander.craft

Edited October 27, 2013 by Mr Tegu

I have an idea for a missile:

It would be a atmospheric missile, maybe a rocket engine attached. It would reenter, decouple a structural panel shroud, then release a ton of the tiny cubic struts. They would be maybe accelerated by boosters, raining misery on the enemy, and creating debris.

fellow spirtwolf allies I think something like a sabre from halo: reach would dominate the field heavy armor good torps and lv 909 engines in a set of 3 maybe 4 and septrons as an emergency escape system just look up yss 1000 on Google you should see the sabre

Ship: SNSS Fibonacci CL-3

Nation: Star Nation

Nation Bio: Star Nation is a technocracy beginning to venture into space. Its current goal is to get a foothold in the Kerbin system via small combat fleets and supply depots. Due to the recent conflicts Star Nation has been developing high velocity torpedos and cannons. Because it is new to space it has no large craft instead it relies on medium sized multirole craft.

http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/star-nation-show-case/

Allegiance: Spiritwolf corporation

Part count: 130

Craft File:http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/snss-fibonacci-2/

Operation Manual

1- Toggles Solar Panels

2- Toggles Poodle Engine

3- Toggles Nuclear Engines

4- Toggles Ion Engines

Armed with 4 light torpedoes and 1 heavy cannon /w 5 shots.

Proof of travel

launch second stage

circlizing orbit

weapon test

armor test

going to the mun

orbiting the mun

Ship: SNSS "Lagrange" MLV-2

Bio: "Lagrange" is a mobile fuel silo able to operate around the entire sol system. It mainly supplies medium to small vessels and is limited in its rocket fuel reserves. It is unarmed.

Part count: 125

Craft File: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/snss-lagrange-w-launch-stage/

Operation Manual:

1. Toggle solar panels

2. Toggle Nuclear engines

(use remote guidance unit for launch)

Proof of flight:

preflight switch to guidance unit

lift off

2nd stage and turn

go for gravity assit from mun

burn for Jool

park it

what a view

Edited November 8, 2013 by iamonfire

I have developed a weapon capable of piercing plate armor reliably and cheaply!

I'm going to test it on some of the craft files here, then give a full report.
Can you test my light cruiser?
The Heavy Drek XIV-II is operational... but not for sale.
...you just love to tease us...
I will release it as soon as they lose a battle... but so far that hasn't happened.

In response to some of the competition Star Nation has started construction of the SNSS "Newton".

This ship is of such large construction that it must be launched in 3 separate sections. It also used hacked gravity, for now.

The first section up was the command pod/fuel reserves. Clocking in at 315 parts.

The second section was the engines. It contains 328 parts 24 of those are nuclear engines.

the third section will be the weapons, this section has been problematic due to its large part count.

The game crashes when I try to add the weapons section, but if it did not then this ship would be armed with six heavy cannons, and three medium missiles.

Edited November 8, 2013 by iamonfire
Can we post save files? That way show case worlds can be made. Also weapon subassemblies and ships could be tested.

Hurricane class battlecruiser:

Stats: 328 parts, 2295LF, 900 MP, 3 1m torps and 6 volleys of 2 girder rockets.

This is the stripped down and simplified version of the original hurricane which sits at between 550 and 600 parts depending on loadout. In order to do this, all the extra layers of armour have been removed, the fuel tank and crossfeed system has been removed as well half of the ammo and all all of the inbuilt systems redundancy.

Despite being the lightweight version it still packs a punch:

A trio of hurricanes showing the different loadouts in LKO:

craft file:http://www./view/kvwzbmkq3v9ixtn/Hurricane_LP.craft

Launch proof (Laythe trip pending) and firepower tests:

Javascript is disabled. View full album
